business.headline: New Income Tax Bill: Will taxpayers with late ITR filings lose refunds?Late ITR filing refund concern: The Income Tax Act, 1961, does not prevent taxpayers from claiming a refund just because the return was filed after the deadline.

Licious, backed by Temasek, preps for massive $2 billion IPO: Report Delightful Gourmet Pvt, the parent company of Licious, is expanding its physical store network and improving delivery times to compete with quick-commerce rivals.

Smallcap stocks are bleeding. What should investors do?Smallcap stocks have been battered by the persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs). A dismal Q3 earnings season has only worsened the situation.

Indian Overseas Bank rolls out Aadhaar-based account opening. Check detailsThis new initiative allows customers to open savings bank accounts online with minimal documentation, as per Reserve Bank of India's eKYC guidelines.

Sensex, Nifty tumble again as volatility grips Dalal Street. 3 things to knowStock Market Today, 18 Feb 2025: Dalal Street remains under pressure with no immediate relief in sight. Here are some key points investors should know.

Tesla eyes India entry for third time. Why EV giant's last two attempts failedTesla in India: Tesla has made two previous attempts to enter the Indian market, both of which ended in failure.  Here's a look at the reasons behind its past setbacks.
Tesla begins hiring in India: Here's the list of job openings and locationsTesla India hiring: Tesla has posted 13 job openings on its LinkedIn page, covering both customer-facing and back-end roles.

Tesla hints at India entry with jobs post days after PM Modi meets Elon MuskTesla has begun hiring in India and has posted several job openings. This comes shortly after Tesla CEO Elon Musk met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his recent visit to the US.

Dalal Street continues to be volatile: What should investors do? Dalal Street volatile: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to settle at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to close at 22,959.50. Despite this recovery, overall market sentiment remains cautious as investors react to various global and domestic factors.

How a change of name caused Bira a loss of Rs 80 crore. Check details Ahead of its IPO, B9 Beverages Private Ltd, the owner of Bira beer, changed its name to B9 Beverages Ltd, causing several compliance hurdles and sales disruptions.

New Income Tax Bill: 10 FAQs you should knowNew Income Tax Bill 2025 explained: The current income tax bill which was enacted in 1961, and came into effect in 1962, consisted of 512,535 words and 819 sections. On the contrary, the new bill consists of 259,676 words, 23 chapters and 536 sections.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

PM SVANidhi scheme: Know about eligibility and Rs 30,000 credit cardsPM SVANidhi scheme eligibility: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget 2025 speech announced providing credit cards under the PM SVANidhi scheme.

Is your money safe in co-operative banks safe? RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. This incident has added to the growing list of cooperative banks facing regulatory action.

India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

Radhika Gupta on market volatility: Bad times don't last. Good investors doRadhika Gupta's advice comes as stock markets continue to witness a downward trend, with the sell-off in smallcap and midcap stocks intensifying.

Senco Gold share price tumbles 32% in 2 sessions. Here's what brokerages saySenco Gold stock price: The sell-off started on February 14 after the company reported its quarterly numbers showing profits plunged 69.3% to Rs 33.48 crore compared to Rs 109.32 crore a year ago.

Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

Should you avoid smallcap, midcap stocks amid ongoing market correction?One of the primary reasons behind this downturn is the steep valuations of smallcap and midcap stocks, which analysts believe had reached unsustainable levels.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.
Sensex, Nifty fall as market sell-off continues; Mahindra shares fall 4% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 458.91 points to 75,480.30, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 145.70 points to 22,783.55 as of 9:42 AM.

New Income Tax bill: What is tax year? How is it different from assessment year?The new bill aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act and one of the key changes introduced in the New Income Tax Bill, 2025, pertains to the concept of the 'tax year.'

Hexaware Technologies IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and GMPHexaware Technologies IPO Allotment: Investors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status online through the registrar, KFin Technologies, or via the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website.
India-Israel free trade deal on the cards: What it means for both nationsA group of over 100 Israeli companies visited India, and held more than 600 business meetings with Indian business leaders.

India slashes import duty on bourbon whisky to 100% after Trump's criticismThe reduction in customs duty on bourbon whisky was notified on February 13 just ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's talks with US President Donald Trump.
What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

New Income Tax bill: Has it really been simplified for taxpayers?The proposed income tax bill seeks to simplify and revamp the Income Tax Act of 1961, which has often been criticised for its complexity, making it challenging for ordinary taxpayers to navigate.
New UPI transaction rule: All you need to know about auto chargeback processThe changes are primarily regarding auto acceptance and rejection of chargebacks, thereby making the system more efficient.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as FIIs continue to exit Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 199.76 points to end at 75,939.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 102.15 points to close at 22,929.25.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price tumbled nearly 6%VI shares were down 5.09% to Rs 8.22 at around 3:15 pm. Earlier during the trading session, shares of the telecom operator fell as much as 6%.

Ambani family richest in Asia. Check which Indian families made the top 20The Ambani family tops Bloomberg's list of Asia's 20 richest families. The family's flagship company, Reliance Industries, is presently headed by Mukesh Ambani, son of late industrialist Dhirubhai Ambani.

RBI curbs on New India Co-operative Bank: How does it impact customers?New India Co-operative Bank has been struggling with financial losses in recent years. According to its annual report, the bank recorded a loss of Rs 22.78 crore in the financial year ending March 2024, following a loss of Rs 30.75 crore in the previous year.

New India Co-operative Bank's financial operations halted after notice from RBIThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has restricted Mumbai-based New India Co-operative Bank from issuing loans, accepting deposits, or permitting withdrawals for six months. The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

RBI issues notice to halt all financial operations of New India Co-operative BankRBI's move comes after what it called 'recent material developments' at the bank. Although the central bank did not provide specific details, it stated that these directions were issued to protect depositors' interests.

New income tax bill: All you questions answeredThe new income tax bill, compared to the Income Tax Act, 1961, is nearly half the size, containing 259,676 words, 23 chapters, 536 sections, 57 tables and 46 formulae.

entertainment.headline: Dabba Cartel trailer: Shabana Azmi, Jyotika promise an addictive showThe trailer for Netflix's Dabba Cartel unveils a gripping crime drama about five women whose dabba business unexpectedly plunges them into the dangerous world of a drug cartel.

Kim Sae-ron's father blames YouTuber for death, co-star Won Bin breaks downSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron's father spoke out at her funeral, held a day after her death, highlighting the emotional distress she suffered due to a YouTuber's videos.

Music composer Amit Trivedi believes their choice is driven by business interests, as they seek lucrative opportunities in the country.

Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

Amortage review: Jisoo's album shakes things up like an 'earthquake'Jisoo's new EP, Amortage, released on February 14, 2025, marks her evolution as a solo artist. The EP blends pop and R&B to explore love's many facets, featuring English tracks and her own songwriting.

Bhabiji writer Manoj Santoshi battles cancer, Shilpa Shinde takes care of himActor Kavita Kaushik made an emotional post on social media, highlighting screenwriter Manoj Santoshi's struggle with liver cancer. She also mentioned actor Shilpa Shinde and thanked her for taking care of him.

The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

Rashami Desai on love-hate bond with Sidharth Shukla: We'd communicate through eyesActor Rashami Desai, who had worked with the late Sidharth Shukla on 'Dil Se Dil Tak' and 'Bigg Boss 13', was reminded of her relationship with him on comedian Bharti Singh's podcast.

Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

Apoorva Mukhija aka Rebel Kid removed from official IIFA ambassador listApoorva Mukhija, known as Rebel Kid, has been removed from the IIFA ambassador list following controversy over her appearance in Samay Raina's show, India's Got Latent. The decision follows threats from Karni Sena to disrupt her upcoming shoot.

Fighting zombies to playing a psychopath: The many faces of Choi Woo-shikLong before Choi Woo-shik became a household name thanks to Parasite, he had already amassed an impressive filmography. The Potato Lab trailer: Kang Tae-oh is set to headline upcoming rom-comThe trailer for The Potato Lab, a romantic comedy-drama starring Kang Tae-oh and Lee Sun-bin, has been released. The series, set in a rural potato research institute, promises a blend of romance, comedy, and workplace drama.

Dhoom Dhaam review: Romance meets thrill in this Yami Gautam-Pratik Gandhi filmReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Dhoom Dhaam movie review: Dhoom Dhaam blends romance with action and comedy, offering a refreshing alternative to traditional Valentine's Day films. Starring Yami Gautam and Pratik Gandhi, the movie delivers a thrilling and entertaining experience perfect for a cosy night in.

Scared of Loving You: Selena Gomez's new song for her Valentine Benny Blanco out Lovebirds Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco have now collaborated for a new album titled I Said I Love You First. On the occasion of Valentine's Day 2025, Selena released the first single from the album, Scared of Loving You.

Ilaiyaraaja appears in Court in dispute with music company over his compositionsIn 2010, Music Master filed a lawsuit seeking a ban on the use of these songs on YouTube and social media platforms, calling it "unauthorised".

Are K-Drama men written by women too good to be true? | Valentine Special K-drama male leads have captivated audiences with their idealised traits, offering a romantic fantasy of the perfect partner. These characters, crafted by female screenwriters, challenge traditional portrayals. This Valentine's Day we analyse if they are too good to be true.
Prime Video's Rings of Power renewed for third seasonPrime Video's Rings of Power has been renewed for the third installment, the makers announced recently. Its second season was released last year.

Mrs director Arati Kadav on backlash over missing credits: Glad it was called outDirector Arati Kadav addresses the backlash over Mrs not crediting The Great Indian Kitchen in the trailer, stressing the need for proper recognition. Mrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, is streaming on Zee5.

Viral video: Kanan Gill made same remark as Ranveer Allahbadia years agoAs Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his India's Got Latent remark, an old video of Kanan Gill asking the same question resurfaces on the internet.

Kanye West, Bianca Censori heading for divorce? Team clarifiesIt was previously reported that singer-rapper Kanye West and his wife, Bianca Censori, had split and were headed for divorce. However, a recent development has refuted these claims, labelling them as "tabloid rumours."

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs. makes questions on marital rape, mechanical sex personalImagine a woman bleeding for five days in a month, and those five days being the most peaceful in her life because she can finally refuse sex to her husband. He can't assert his power over her. That's how Sanya Malhotra's 'Mrs.' unsettles you and makes you think.

Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani meets with an accident, undergoes treatmentVishal Dadlani of the Vishal-Sheykhar duo is undergoing treatment after an accident, leading to the postponement of their upcoming concert scheduled for March 2.

Not just Gujarat, all Samay Raina shows cancelled amid India's Got Latent rowSamay Raina's shows in India have been cancelled following controversy around India's Got Latent, with Gujarat shows being the first to be affected.

general news.headline: Supreme Court shields Ranveer Allahbadia from arrest, says no shows for nowThe Supreme Court granted relief to YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia from being arrested over his obscene joke on 'India's Got Latent' show, but rapped him over his remarks, saying his "perverted mind made the entire society feel ashamed".

Disrespectful: Rahul Gandhi's dissent on 'midnight' move to pick poll body chiefRahul Gandhi, who was part of the panel to pick the chief election commissioner, said the government's hasty move was disrespectful and discourteous.

Need to do something: Top court notice to Centre over obscene content on YouTubeNoting that YouTubers were misusing the lack of regulation of obscene content on YouTube, the Supreme Court issued notice to Centre and called for regulation of vulgar content amid Ranveer Allahbadia's 'India's Got Latent' row.

Telangana eases work hours for Muslims during Ramzan, BJP slams 'appeasement'The Telangana government's move to allow Muslim employees leave early during Ramzan has sparked controversy, with BJP leaders accusing the government of appeasement politics and calling for equal treatment for all religious groups.

Amid H-1B visa backlash, a look at other US work visa optionsThe H-1B visa remains the most popular choice among American work visas for Indians. However, the H-1B visa system is facing scrutiny after Donald Trump's return as the US President. Here are the lesser-known work visa categories, like H-2A, H-2B, H-3, L, O, P, Q, and R visas, that offer opportunities to work in the US.

Odisha college apologises, suspends 3 staffers amid Nepali student's suicide rowPrakriti Lamsal, a BTech student, was found dead in her hostel room at KIIT on Sunday, triggering protests by the over 500 Nepali students on the campus.

Trump's $500 billion Ukraine payback exceeds German war reparations: ReportThe US has offered a USD 500 billion deal for war-hit Ukraine, allowing it to have exclusive access to the European country's rare earth minerals, oil and gas production, and its ports and other-related infrastructure.

7 Tamil Nadu students arrested for minor's sexual assault, Opposition slams DMKSeven college students in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore were arrested under Pocso Act for sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl. Opposition, including AIADMK and BJP, slammed the ruling DMK for the deteriorating law and order in the state.

What Ranveer Allahbadia did after making crass joke? 'Audience member' revealsIn a now-viral video, a Mumbai-based man, who claimed to be a member of the audience present during the shoot of the particular episode of the show, revealed what Ranveer Allahbadia did after he made the crass joke.

US, Russia begin talks to end Ukraine war, Zelenskyy watches from afarDelegations led by US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov met in Riyadh. The meeting marks another pivotal step by the Trump administration to reverse US policy on isolating Russia.

BCCI allows families to attend one match in Dubai, prior permission neededThe Indian cricket board has allowed families and partners of cricketers to watch one match of the Champions Trophy 2025. However, the players will need to inform the BCCI and seek permission from them prior to the game.

Two students use Fortuner, BMW to do 'donuts' on Hyderabad road, arrestedThe police arrested two students for performing reckless stunts in a BMW SUV and a Toyota Fortuner on Hyderabad's Outer Ring Road. The two were taken into custody after CCTV footage helped the police track them down.

Born at the 'right' time: The growing craze for Mahurat Deliveries in IndiaMahurat delivery craze in India: More and more people are opting for Mahurat Deliveries, believing that in an uncertain world, they can influence their baby's fate and ensure an 'auspicious', 'blessed' future.

Bhool Chuk Maaf: Rajkummar Rao returns to entertain on loop with his Desi swagActors Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi appear in a romantic comedy, titled 'Bhool Chuk Maaf', exploring a 'time loop' theme. The makers released the teaser of the film on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
